I was promoted to lead and mentor QA teams and testing for development of clients' software and systems to provide cutting-edge road safety camera and automated toll collections projects to exceed safety and enforcement requirements. I presently focus on:●     Establish and optimize IT compliance measurements used in minimizing project quality risks to ensure crucial deadlines are achieved to meet and exceed client requirements.●     Eliminate deficiencies, and maintain and track all design changes throughout project phases in conjunction with leaders, development, and BA teams.●      Created life-cycle, processor-specific, and web-service automation suites utilizing organic platform to increase manual to automated testing from 0% to 95% within one year. ●      Developed cross-product integration automation suites which shortened new client on-boarding process from months to days. ●      Automated front-end UI's using Selenium Webdriver via Java.I had previously served as the Senior QA Engineer - Product Development from 2011 - 2015 where I employed Agile/Scrum methodologies and collaborated with commercial services development team to streamline web-based (Oracle DB) services for fleet clients to minimize client cost.I had:●     Provided subject matter expertise in implementing PlatePass solution suite as foundation of revenue producer for ATS, and in establishing innovative application-based inventory tracking system.●     Created and sustained manual/automated test plans, QA process, story documentation, defect tracking, and hotfix acceleration across applications utilizing Quality Center, Version One and TFS.●     Determined optimal and future automation testing software, and initialized software launches aligned withthree-week sprint cycles.●     Integrated and oversaw soapUI architecture used in web service-based testing, soapUI regression suite used by QA team, and trained associates in maximizing use of soapUI.

As Quality Assurance Engineer, I had developed and provided software and applications containing algorithms to mitigate trademark fraud, losses, and infringements of key clients' company information.My additional successes:●     Completed front-end UI performance testing, metrics gathering, and reporting through Apache JMeter automation scripts as independent contributor, and supported Tier 1 and 2 clients in team environments.●     Identified and designed existing and future testing software tools SilkTest, QA Wizard Pro and Web Performance Load Tester, and resolved legacy application deficiencies through JIRA and 411 bug tracking software.

The final role with JDA provided me the opportunity to oversee the quality assurance department's role in joining customer-directed development division to restructure software lifecycle with agile development methodologies.I had:●     Resurrected, modified and established a SilkTest functional and regression automation harness for the PMM retail application suite●     Created code check-in structural process within PVCS to guide U.S. and India automation teams in coordinated efforts, and built onsite enterprise team in India.●     Established uniform automation testing standards, and aligned U.S. and offshore based development and test teams' functions as basis of manual/automated cross-testing policies and procedures.I had been promoted from the role of Senior QA Analyst, which I held from 2003 to 2007 and mentored and engaged associates, consultants, and customers through software applications optimization, and led testing of multiple GUI, UNIFACE, .NET, Batch, SQL, and ORACLE DB import and export platforms.Accomplishments:●     Designed and created manual test plans, cases, and scripts for new and existing applications reflective of clients' requests.●     Identified, tested, and reduced bugs prior to QA approval of software, and managed ten ORACLE and MSSQL virtual and desktop servers to sustain client code-stream.●     Produced in-depth training and user manuals for product and self-supervised software releases through using RoboHelp.I began with the company as a Business Analyst from 2002 to 2003 and:●     Collaborated in design division's functional improvements to accommodate client's modifications to base. ●     Joined QA team in considering viable business scenarios applicable to functional testing.

●     Managed P&L, receiving, cash office, payroll, staffing, expense, shortage control, safety standards, customer service, new account management, and 21 managers with 600 associates for $65M, 315,000 square foot flagship store.

Assistant Store Manager with responsibility for $12.5 million. Major responsibilities included resource management, communication with buying office to resolve issues and planning, inventory data integrity and ready to wear market strategy.
recommendations: Director of Application Development at TrendShift

I have worked with Sean for about a year and a half now since joining ATS. He embodies the ATS Core Values - - Integrity, Teamwork, Respect, Excellence, and Accountability – in all that he does. His quality of work is outstanding. He does everything in his power to deliver a defect free product each sprint. He's enthusiastic, energetic and has a positive attitude. He displays strong analytical skills, is quick to learn and adapt new systems and processes, has a strong work ethic, and actively takes on the mentoring/training of his team and others.Testing is a back-end activity so when things don't go according to plan, it frequently requires extra effort to successfully complete tasking committed to during sprint planning. Sean has far exceeded reasonable expectations to ensure successful completion of those tasks. His test plans are concise and comprehensive. Test steps are evident in the execution and data flow, but comments and descriptions are included so as to allow any team member to pick up a task. This allows the team to be truly agile in the performance of the testing tasks.The level of detail he provides for manually executed tests allows for quick and easy migration to test automation – something that is allowing us to quickly tackle the most significant end-to-end/regression flows for our software.

I've had the privilege of working with Sean since I started with ATS. Sean exemplifies the key qualities required to excel in his role as a Sr. QA Engineer.  Sean’s passion and dedication to ensuring quality products are delivered is, in my mind, immeasurable.  Sean has an uncanny ability to dissect complicated systems and thrives on developing subject matter expertise in all he does.  Not only does Sean have a thirst for knowledge himself, he finds great satisfaction in developing tools and producing detailed documentation as a means to knowledge share with other members of the organization.  I sincerely appreciate Sean’s passion, his willingness to knowledge share, his work ethic and his desire to be a key player in producing the highest quality products in the market.  He’s definitely an invaluable asset to any organization.

Sean is a very good QA Engineer - he spends a good deal of time learning how functionality should work and then tests all the possible scenarios.  He documents all of his findings which better enables the developers to resolve the issues quickly.  In addition, he works with the members of the design team to determine if there are really issues or perhaps even design flaws.  He is a dedicated team player and definitely self-motivated.  He always wants to do the right thing for the product and for the team.  Sean is a real asset to the team and to the company

Fred has quickly become one of my favorite managers for whom I have worked. Fred’s dedication to ensuring a very productive team atmosphere, and his unequaled drive to support professional development has fostered loyalty from his associates. His management style encourages all employees to willingly go the extra mile for him. I have a very strong work ethic, but working for Fred has escalated me to the next level of commitment. The vast knowledge and seasoned leadership he brought to ATS was sorely needed and calmed the turbulent waters. He encourages autonomy for those who prove themselves and strives to ensure everything we need to be productive is supplied when possible. I would very gladly work for Fred anytime and anywhere. He is an asset to any company as well as an invaluable asset to all those who work within his team.

summary: As a Lead Software Quality Assurance Engineer, I manage projects to improve software development, testing, and quality assurance that fully satisfies customer requirements. I am a proven mentor with an exceptional track record of developing staff, team, peer, and client leadership through onshore and offshore initiatives. My skills also extend to troubleshooting technology deficiencies to identify, isolate and resolve technical issues through use of Agile and Scrum methodologies. This considerable capability lies in tracking and mitigating system bugs to meet and exceed design and project deliverables. Being an accomplished communicator skilled in building and strengthening relationships across functions to drive cohesive and strategic operations, I consider my qualifications those that transcend industries and projects.
name: Sean Haines
title: Lead Software QA Engineer at American Traffic Solutions
